channel.title: Comments for page "Wasteland Scythe"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Wasteland Scythe"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
my experience in distilling wasteland quality items is that basically you distill the item, add rune to the result, then add the final part…

in this item's case you'd get the excellent polearm from distillation… then fuse the rune to the polearm, and attach a new sharp crystal for the Scythe of Razing. while I haven't distilled a wasteland scythe to verify, it was like this for the cowl and boots and so I'm assuming it's the same for the rest of the wasteland items..

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I'd guess that it would become a Excellent Polearm so you could more easily create the runic items. Then again, McM isn't all about making it easy on us.

item.content:encoded: From the item page for Excellent Polearm, it turns into one of those when distilled. Although I do agree that the link should be on the Wasteland Scythe page as well.

Has anyone tried distilling the Wasteland Scythe to see what it turns back into?
I see plenty of Distill info on dropped items, but not for crafted permanents. This type of info would be useful, say if you were trying to make the magical rune version of an item and didn't want to hunt down all the ingredients again.
